question: Rupture can cause fragments of what to travel via the bloodstream and become lodged in other arteries?

nodes.text: Enamel fragments can travel via the bloodstream and become lodged in other arteries after rupture.
Red blood cells can cause fragments to travel via the bloodstream and become lodged in other arteries if ruptured.
White blood cells can cause fragments to travel via the bloodstream and become lodged in other arteries when rupture occurs.
Plaque rupture can cause fragments to travel via the bloodstream and become lodged in other arteries.
